paragraphs.text:
%md
# **ETL - EXTRACTION**

This notebook is extracting all data stored in a database lying in HDFS
To upload a file into HDFS from linux command line:

1. Create a HDFS directory
`$ hadoop fs -mkdir <designed-HDFS-directory-route>` 

2. Copy from linux to HDFS
`$ hadoop dfs -copyFromLocal <route-to-linux-sourcefile-or-directory> <route-to-HDFS-destination-file-or-directory>`

3. Generated dataframes:
    - uk_hd: holidays according to uk bank
    - acorn_cats: acorn categories and their population percentage. More information available at [CACI ACORN webpage](https://www.caci.co.uk/products/product/acorn)
    - acorn_groups: acorn groups and their categories
    - information_households: information about household's meter and file location
    - weather_daily_darksky: weather information for each day
    - weather_hourly_darksky: weather information for each hour
    - half_block_dataset/block_0-111: household's consumption each half hour (time series)
    - hhblock_dataset/block_0-111: household's consumption each half hour (hour matrix)
    - tariff: tafirff matrix per user each half hour

msg.data:
ETL - EXTRACTION

This notebook is extracting all data stored in a database lying in HDFS
To upload a file into HDFS from linux command line:

  1. Create a HDFS directory
    $ hadoop fs -mkdir <designed-HDFS-directory-route>

  2. Copy from linux to HDFS
    $ hadoop dfs -copyFromLocal <route-to-linux-sourcefile-or-directory> <route-to-HDFS-destination-file-or-directory>

  3. Generated dataframes:

    • uk_hd: holidays according to uk bank
    • acorn_cats: acorn categories and their population percentage. More information available at CACI ACORN webpage
    • acorn_groups: acorn groups and their categories
    • information_households: information about household’s meter and file location
    • weather_daily_darksky: weather information for each day
    • weather_hourly_darksky: weather information for each hour
    • half_block_dataset/block_0-111: household’s consumption each half hour (time series)
    • hhblock_dataset/block_0-111: household’s consumption each half hour (hour matrix)
    • tariff: tafirff matrix per user each half hour

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Imports and Basic Functions

Imports all needed libraries. Some pre-defined variables and functions are:

1. dir_in: Directory where database is located
2. server: Hadoop server ip direction and port
3. mes_et: Function to measure any cell execution elapsed time
4. test: How many of 112 blocks you need to dismiss for tests. Test=0 means you consider all 112 blocks in data processing

msg.data:
Imports and Basic Functions

Imports all needed libraries. Some pre-defined variables and functions are:

  1. dir_in: Directory where database is located
  2. server: Hadoop server ip direction and port
  3. mes_et: Function to measure any cell execution elapsed time
  4. test: How many of 112 blocks you need to dismiss for tests. Test=0 means you consider all 112 blocks in data processing

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.types import *
import subprocess
import time
gbl = globals()


dir_in = "/JSGP/datasets/london/data_source/"
server="hdfs://big0.iie.org.mx:9000/"
test=0

# Measure Elapsed time
def mes_et(startTimeQuery):
    endTimeQuery = time.time()
    runTimeQuery = endTimeQuery - startTimeQuery
    print("ELAPSED TIME: "+str(runTimeQuery)+" seconds")

%md
### uk_hd dataframe
Extracts a list of London holidays, accordint to UK Bank.

- HD_DATE: Holiday Date
- HD_NAME: Holiday Name

msg.data:
uk_hd dataframe

Extracts a list of London holidays, accordint to UK Bank.

  • HD_DATE: Holiday Date
  • HD_NAME: Holiday Name

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
startTimeQuery = time.time()
file="uk_bank_holidays.csv"
subdir=""

uk_hd=spark.read.csv(server+dir_in+subdir+file, header=True, schema = 'HD_DATE string, HD_NAME string')
uk_hd.collect()
mes_et(startTimeQuery)
"""            
for older Spark Versions:
uk_hd=spark.read.csv(server+dir_in+subdir+file, header=True, schema = StructType([
                        StructField('HD_DATE', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('HD_NAME', StringType(), True)]))
"""
uk_hd.show(30)

paragraphs.text:
%md
### acorn_cats dataframe
A list with Households' ACORN categories and the % of population for each one.

- ACORN_CAT: Category number (0-5)
- ACORN_CAT_NAME: Category name
- CAT_POPULATION: % of households classified under each category

More information about households ACORN categories in [ACORN household User Guide](http://www.caci.co.uk/sites/default/files/resources/Household_Acorn_UG.pdf)

msg.data:
acorn_cats dataframe

A list with Households’ ACORN categories and the % of population for each one.

  • ACORN_CAT: Category number (0-5)
  • ACORN_CAT_NAME: Category name
  • CAT_POPULATION: % of households classified under each category

More information about households ACORN categories in ACORN household User Guide

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
startTimeQuery = time.time()
file="acorn_hh_categories.csv"
subdir=""
acorn_cats=spark.read.csv(server+dir_in+subdir+file, header=True, schema = StructType([
                        StructField('ACORN_CAT', IntegerType(), True),
                        StructField('ACORN_CAT_NAME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('CAT_POPULATION', DoubleType(), True)]))   
acorn_cats.collect()
mes_et(startTimeQuery)
acorn_cats.show()

%md
### acorn_groups dataframe
A list with Households' ACORN groups and the category for each one.

- ACORN_CAT: Category number (0-5)
- ACORN_GROUP: ACORN Group (A to Q)
- ACORN_CAT_NAME: Category name

More information about households ACORN categories in [ACORN household User Guide](http://www.caci.co.uk/sites/default/files/resources/Household_Acorn_UG.pdf)

paragraphs.text:
%md
### information_households dataframe

Information about each client (meter) ACORN classification

- METER_ID: Meter ID for each client
- STD_TOU: Indicates weather a client is participating in Standard or TimeOfUse tariff
- ACORN_GROUP: Household group
- ACORN_GROUP_NANME: Household group name
- FILE: block file where information about client is located

Information about each client (meter) ACORN classification

  • METER_ID: Meter ID for each client
  • STD_TOU: Indicates weather a client is participating in Standard or TimeOfUse tariff
  • ACORN_GROUP: Household group
  • ACORN_GROUP_NANME: Household group name
  • FILE: block file where information about client is located

                        StructField('ACORN_GROUP', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('ACORN_GROUP_NAME', StringType(), True),

%md
### weather_daily_darksky dataframe

Weather information for each day. Details for each column available at [Dark Sky API](https://darksky.net/dev/docs#response-format)

weather_daily_darksky dataframe

Weather information for each day. Details for each column available at Dark Sky API

%pyspark
startTimeQuery = time.time()
file="weather_daily_darksky.csv"
subdir=""
weather_daily_darksky=spark.read.csv(server+dir_in+subdir+file, header=True, schema = StructType([
                        StructField('TEMP_MAX', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('TEMP_MAX_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('WIND_BEARING', IntegerType(), True),
                        StructField('ICON', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('DEWPOINT', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('TEMP_MIN_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('CLOUD_COVER', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('WIND_SPEED', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('PRESSURE', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_MIN_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_HI', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('PRECIP_TYPE', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('VISIBILITY', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HUMIDITY', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_HI_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_LO', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_MAX', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('UV_INDEX', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('SUNSET_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('TEMP_LO', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('TEMP_MIN', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('TEMP_HI', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('SUNRISE_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('TEMP_HI_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('UV_INDEX_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('SUMMARY', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('TEMP_LO_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_MIN', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_MAX_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('APAR_TEMP_LO_TIME', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('MOONPHASE', DoubleType(), True)]))
weather_daily_darksky.collect()
mes_et(startTimeQuery)
weather_daily_darksky.show(5)

%md
### half_block (0-111) dataframes

Information about energy consumption for each client, each half hour.

- METER_ID:  Meter ID for each client
- TIMESTAMP: Measurement date and time
- ENERGY: Total energy consumptiion for each day

msg.data:
half_block (0-111) dataframes

Information about energy consumption for each client, each half hour.

  • METER_ID: Meter ID for each client
  • TIMESTAMP: Measurement date and time
  • ENERGY: Total energy consumptiion for each day

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

startTimeQuery = time.time()
subdir="halfhourly_dataset/"
args = "hdfs dfs -ls "+dir_in+subdir+" | awk '{print $8}'"
proc = subprocess.Popen(args, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True)
s_output, s_err = proc.communicate()
block_list = s_output.split()

#iterate through all files in directory to generate a dataframe for each file 
for i in range(len(block_list)):
    block="block_"+`i`
    block_name="half_"+block
    block_path=server+dir_in+subdir+block+".csv"
    df=spark.read.csv(block_path, header=True, schema = StructType([
                        StructField('METER_ID', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('TIMESTAMP', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('ENERGY', DoubleType(), True)])) 
    gbl[block_name]= df
    
mes_et(startTimeQuery)
half_block_111.show(5)

%md
### hh_block (0-111) dataframes

Information about energy consumption for each client, each half hour.

- METER_ID:  Meter ID for each client
- DATE: Measurement date
- HH_X: Energy measurement for each 30 minutes. From HH_0 = 00:00 to HH_47=23:30

msg.data:
hh_block (0-111) dataframes

Information about energy consumption for each client, each half hour.

  • METER_ID: Meter ID for each client
  • DATE: Measurement date
  • HH_X: Energy measurement for each 30 minutes. From HH_0 = 00:00 to HH_47=23:30

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
startTimeQuery = time.time()
subdir="hhblock_dataset/"
args = "hdfs dfs -ls "+dir_in+subdir+" | awk '{print $8}'"
proc = subprocess.Popen(args, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True)
s_output, s_err = proc.communicate()
block_list = s_output.split()

#iterate through all files in directory to generate a dataframe for each file 
for i in range(len(block_list)):
    block="block_"+`i`
    block_name="hh_"+block
    block_path=server+dir_in+subdir+block+".csv"
    hh_block=spark.read.csv(block_path, header=True, schema = StructType([
                        StructField('METER_ID', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('DATE', StringType(), True),
                        StructField('HH0', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH1', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH2', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH3', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH4', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH5', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH6', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH7', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH8', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH9', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH10', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH11', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH12', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH13', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH14', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH15', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH16', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH17', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH18', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH19', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH20', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH21', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH22', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH23', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH24', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH25', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH26', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH27', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH28', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH29', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH30', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH31', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH32', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH33', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH34', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH35', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH36', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH37', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH38', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH39', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH40', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH41', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH42', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH43', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH44', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH45', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH46', DoubleType(), True),
                        StructField('HH47', DoubleType(), True)])) 
    gbl[block_name]= hh_block

mes_et(startTimeQuery)
hh_block_110.show(5)

%md
### tariff dataframe

Information about tariff for ToU users. Tariff codes are:

- 0: Normal tariff, 11.76 p/kWh
- 1: High tariff, 67.20 p/kWh
- 2: Low tariff, 3.99 p/kWh

Columns are:

- Date: Tariff date
- HHX: tariff code for each half hour

msg.data:
tariff dataframe

Information about tariff for ToU users. Tariff codes are:

  • 0: Normal tariff, 11.76 p/kWh
  • 1: High tariff, 67.20 p/kWh
  • 2: Low tariff, 3.99 p/kWh

Columns are:

  • Date: Tariff date
  • HHX: tariff code for each half hour

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
startTimeQuery = time.time()

file="tariff_matrix.csv"
subdir=""
tariff = spark.read.csv(server+dir_in+subdir+file,header=True)
tariff=tariff.toDF(*hh_block.columns[1::])
tariff.collect()
mes_et(startTimeQuery)
tariff.printSchema()
